forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain and patchy fog before 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 35. Southwest wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 41, with temperatures falling to around 35 in the afternoon. West wind 7 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph.

weather_report:
Tonight in Boston, a soft murmur of rain falls, mingling with a touch of unobtrusive fog that quietly envelops the evening. The air carries a crisp chill, reminiscent of an autumn's retreat, as temperatures dip to a low of about 35 degrees. A gentle southwest wind whispers through the streets, stirring leaves and minds alike, making it wise to wrap oneself in layers and perhaps don a hat to brush away the nips of cold and moisture. 

Looking ahead to the morrow, Boston will emerge into a realm of sunlight, albeit fleeting, as the high reaches up to 41 degrees before the afternoon settles into a cooler embrace around 35. A westerly breeze will accompany the day, lively at times, beckoning residents to appreciate the glow of the sun while it lasts. One might venture outside to explore the quieter charms of the city, perhaps indulging in a stroll through lush, empty parks or enjoying a hot beverage from a local café, in cozy layers that balance warmth with comfort. It’s a day that invites attention to the gentle transitions of nature while encouraging quiet moments amid the bustling life of Boston.
